edu.biu.scapi.tools.math
Class MathAlgorithms

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.tools.math.MathAlgorithms

public class MathAlgorithms
extends java.lang.Object

This class holds general math algorithms needed by cryptographic algorithms.

Each algorithm is represented by a static function that can be called independently from the other algorithms.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)

Nested Class Summary

          This class holds the result of calculating the square root of a BigInteger.

Method Detail

chineseRemainderTheorem

public static java.math.BigInteger chineseRemainderTheorem(java.util.Vector<java.math.BigInteger> congruences,
                                                           java.util.Vector<java.math.BigInteger> moduli)
Computes the integer x that is expressed through the given primes and the congruences with the chinese remainder theorem (CRT).

Parameters:
congruences - the congruences c_i
moduli - the primes p_i
Returns:
an integer x for that x % p_i == c_i

factorialBI

Computes n! (n factorial)

Parameters:

Returns:
n! as a BigInteger

sqrtModP_3_4

public static MathAlgorithms.SquareRootResults sqrtModP_3_4(java.math.BigInteger z,
                                                            java.math.BigInteger p)
This function calculates the square root of z mod p if and only if p is a prime such that p = 3 mod 4. This function assumes that p is a prime and does not perform the primality check for efficiency reasons.

Parameters:
z - the number for which we calculate the square root
p - the mod
Returns:
SquareRootResults which is a pair of BigIntegers x and -x such that z = x^2 and z = -x^2
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if p != 3 mod 4
